metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15605 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
HTTP request smuggling in Node.js 10, 12, and 13 causes malicious payload delivery when transfer-encoding is malformed

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15605` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
nodejs - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1').
